In this post we build a graph from articles of the World Economic Forumâ€™s Agenda where we attempt reveal underlying editorial themes.

Weâ€™ll use just four packages, weforum which will allow us to download the articles of the Agenda then weâ€™ll use dplyr and purrr to process the data, and finally weâ€™ll use sigmajs to visualise the graph.

First weâ€™ll fetch 7,500 articles.

# remotes::install_github("news-r/weforum")
library(weforum)

articles <- wef_articles_list(pages = 300)

save(articles, file = "articles.RData")

The articles have

library(dplyr)
## Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 3.5.2
## 
## Attaching package: 'dplyr'
## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
## 
##     filter, lag
## The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
## 
##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(purrr)
## Warning: package 'purrr' was built under R version 3.5.2

ids <- articles %>% 
  map("id") %>% 
  unlist()

titles <- articles %>% 
  map("attributes") %>% 
  map("title") %>% 
  unlist()

title_id_keypair <- tibble::tibble(
  article_id = ids,
  article_title = titles
)

edges <- articles %>% 
  map("relationships") %>% 
  map("topics") %>% 
  map("data") %>% 
  flatten() %>% 
  map2(ids, function(x, y) {
    if(length(x))
      x$article_id <- y
    return(x)
  }) %>% 
  map_dfr(bind_rows)

edges <- edges %>% 
  left_join(title_id_keypair, by = "article_id")

library(sigmajs)
## Welcome to sigmajs
## 
## Docs: sigmajs.john-coene.com

edges <- edges %>% 
  select(
    topic_id = id,
    topic_title = title,
    article_id,
    article_title
  ) %>% 
  mutate(
    topic_id = paste0("topic_", topic_id),
    article_id = paste0("article_", article_id)
  ) %>% 
  distinct() %>% 
  mutate(id = 1:n()) 

nodes <- edges %>% 
  select(id = topic_id, name = topic_title) %>% 
  bind_rows(
    edges %>% 
      select(id = article_id, name = article_title)
  ) %>% 
  count(id, name) %>% 
  mutate(
    type = case_when(
      grepl("article", id) ~ "article",
      TRUE ~ "topic"
    ),
    color = case_when(
      type == "article" ~ "#247BA0",
      TRUE ~ "#FF1654"
    )
  )

library(g2r)

g2(nodes, asp(n)) %>% 
  fig_histogram()

sigmajs() %>% 
  sg_nodes(nodes, id, label = name, size = n, color) %>% 
  sg_edges(edges, id, source = topic_id, target = article_id) %>% 
  sg_settings(
    minNodeSize = 1,
    maxNodeSize = 5,
    edgeColor = "default",
    defaultEdgeColor = "rgba(211, 211, 211, 0.2)",
    batchEdgesDrawing = TRUE
  ) %>% 
  # sg_cluster(colors = c("#247BA0", "#70C1B3", "#B2DBBF", "#F3FFBD", "#FF1654")) %>% 
  sg_force_start() %>% 
  sg_force_stop(25000) %>% 
  sg_neighbours()
